Package berlin.hu.cep.connector

Provides the classes necessary to configure a running Kafka Connect instance.

The package is build to read custom json configuration files and deploy them accordingly. To handle json file the package relies on FasterXML's Jackson Project To configure Kafka Connect via it's REST-API this package uses Retrofit.

The package should configure Zeebe Source Connectors and Zeebe Sink Connectors so that Kafka can transport events between a zeebe and a siddhi instance.

Optionally the package can configure MongoDB Connectors so that events get logged in a MongoDB instance.

Author:
Lukas Gehring, Leon Haussknecht, Maurice Lindner, Jost Hermann Triller, Stefan Zabka
See Also:
Apache Kafka, Zeebe, Siddhi
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    RestAPI
    An java interface which represents parts of the Kafka Connect Rest Interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConnectClient
    A class which holds several Kafka Connect configurations, for connection to Zeebe.
    ConnectorConfig
    An abstract class for Kafka Connect configurations.
    ConnectorPostObject
    A class which can be send to Kafka Connect as a json-object trough a POST method.
    MongoDBConnectConfig
    A class to configure a MongoDBSinkConnector for Kafka Connect with sane defaults.
    ZeebeConfig
    Abstract superclass for Zeebe configurations.
    ZeebeSinkConfig
    A class to configure a Zeebe Sink Connector with sane defaults.
    ZeebeSourceConfig
    A class to configure a Zeebe Source Connector with sane defaults.
